content:
I do not have access to real-time information, but i can provide general information on the pollution in new delhi based on recent reports.

new delhi has been facing severe air pollution problems for many years. the main sources of pollution are vehicular emissions, construction activities, open burning of waste and crops, and industrial emissions. the city experiences a particularly bad smog season during winter months, resulting in thick layers of smog covering the city for days

recent reports suggest that air quality in new delhi has deteriorated to a hazardous level in certain areas, with the air quality index (aqi) reaching well above 500 in some locations. this level is considered very unhealthy and can have severe health effects on the population, particularly on young children, the elderly, and those with respiratory problems. the government of india has implemented various measures over the years to control pollution, such as banning the use of firecrackers during diwali and banning the use of old vehicles, but it continues to be a significant issue.
